title: encryption, password reset and confirming deletion of data
body:
iâ€™m uneasy about cases where we seemingly donâ€™t make a big deal out of data loss, even if itâ€™s supposedly confirmed by users. namingly encryption and password reset (thought about it from the password reset checkbox mentioned in #3771 and #3783). the checkbox which shows up on the password reset flow (if your files are encrypted) says something like â»bla bla encryption bla if you lost your password your files are pretty much gone except if you talk to the admin etcâ«, and the problems with it are:

* essentially itâ€™s a â»yep, delete all my filesâ« checkbox. not good.
* it asks â»if you haven't enabled the recovery keyâ« â€“ donâ€™t we know that?
* if the recovery key is not enabled and you forget your password, your files are lost, right? it should not be possible to have encryption without recovery key.
* even when the recovery key is enabled, there needs to be admin interaction, right?
* no one reads long advisory texts. tl;dr my data will be gone if i check the box.

seems that enabled encryption + lost password always means either data loss or admin help. hence iâ€™d say we make it impossible to go for the data loss way and make admin interaction mandatory. that means:

* [ ] encryption should not be possible without recovery key. if you donâ€™t trust the admin, host your own instance
* [ ] password reset should not be possible when encryption is enabled. admin contact (and recovery key stuff) should be mandatory.
